required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intra-Operative Metrics With CENTURION and INFINITI Vision Systems
clinical_study.official_title: Intra-Operative Metrics and Clinical Outcomes After Cataract Surgery With the CENTURION Vision System and the INFINITI Vision System

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if intra-operative phacoemulsification machine metrics are lower after phacoemulsification with the CENTURION vision system compared with the INFINITI vision system.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: Cumulative Dissipated Energy is the amount of ultrasound energy entering the eye during the removal of the cataractous lens. CDE will be reported on the Vision System interface and measured in percent-seconds.
Aspiration fluid is the amount of fluid used during the removal of the cataractous lens. Aspiration fluid will be weighed and measured in grams.

secondary_outcome.description: Aspiration time will be reported on the Vision System interface and measured in minutes and seconds.

arm_group.description: CENTURION Vision System randomly assigned to first surgical eye, with INFINITI Vision System assigned to second surgical eye (fellow eye). Each eye will receive a single treatment with estimated duration of less than 30 minutes. The second eye surgery will occur within 14 days of first eye surgery.

INFINITI Vision System randomly assigned to first surgical eye, with CENTURION Vision System assigned to second surgical eye (fellow eye). Each eye will receive a single treatment with estimated duration of less than 30 minutes. The second eye surgery will occur within 14 days of first eye surgery.

intervention.description: Phacoemulsification aspiration platform for use during routine cataract extraction by phacoemulsification with intraocular lens implantation.
IVS is a phacoemulsification aspiration platform for use during routine cataract extraction by phacoemulsification with intraocular lens implantation.

facility.name: Contact Alcon Call Center for Trial Locations
